description.other_contributors: Koray Atalag, University of Auckland, New Zealand

details.purpose: To record the TNM staging classification for prostate cancer (Sixth Edition).
details.use: Use only for the Sixth edition of TNM prostate classification.
details.misuse: Not to be used for other editions of TNM classification. Not to be to stage transitional cell carcinoma of the prostate.

description.other_details:
American Joint Committee on Cancer. TNM schema files [Internet]. [cited 2009 Jul 27 ] Available from: http://www.cancerstaging.org/education/tnmschema/tnmschema.html
Greene FL, Page DL, Fleming ID. et al, eds, for the American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 6th ed. New York, NY: Springer-Verlag; 2002.

items.items: Metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease.
Metastasis to regional nodes no larger than 0.2cm.
Clinically inapparent tumour not palpable or visible by imaging.
Tumour incidental histological finding in 5% or less of tissue resected.
Tumour incidental histological finding in more than 5% of tissue resected.
Tumour involves one half of one lobe or less.
Tumour involves more than half of one lobe, but not both lobes.
Tumour extends through the prostatic capsule.
Tumour is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles: bladder neck, external sphincter, rectum, levator muscles, or pelvic wall.
Clinically inapparent tumour not palpable or visible by imaging.
Tumour incidental histological finding in 5% or less of tissue resected.
Tumour incidental histological finding in more than 5% of tissue resected.
Tumour involves one half of one lobe or less.
Tumour involves more than half of one lobe, but not both lobes.
Tumour extends through the prostatic capsule.
Tumour is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles: bladder neck, external sphincter, rectum, levator muscles, or pelvic wall.
Clinically inapparent tumour not palpable or visible by imaging.
Tumour incidental histological finding in 5% or less of tissue resected.
Tumour incidental histological finding in more than 5% of tissue resected.
Tumour involves one half of one lobe or less.
Tumour involves more than half of one lobe, but not both lobes.
Tumour extends through the prostatic capsule.
Tumour is fixed or invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles: bladder neck, external sphincter, rectum, levator muscles, or pelvic wall.
No metastasis to regional lymph nodes.
Metastasis to ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal nodes.
Metastasis to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular nodes.
No metastasis to regional lymph nodes.
Metastasis to other site(s) with or without bone disease.
A framework for the classification and grading of malignancies using the TNM classification system.
TNM Staging classification for prostate cancer (Sixth edition).
Clinical TNM pre-treatment classification based on physical examination, imaging and biopsies.
Clincal assessment of the primary tumour.
Clinical assessment of the regional lymph nodes.
Pathological staging. Based on the clinical staging, results of procedures and pathological/histo-pathological assessment.
Pathological assessment of the primary tumour.
Pathological assessment of the regional lymph nodes.
The overall Clinical staging derived from each T, N and M component e.g T1aM0NX. May include additional TNM descriptors.
The overall Pathological staging derived from each pT, pN and pM component. May include additional TNM descriptors.
A text comment on the Clinical staging.
A text comment on the Pathological staging.
Clinical assessment of post-treatment residual tumour.
Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed.
Pathological assessment of post-treatment residual tumour.
Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed.
Grade of differentiation cannot be assessed.
